content: <metadata><idinfo><citation><citeinfo><origin>Boise National Forest GIS staff</origin><pubdate>Unknown</pubdate><title>Burn Intensity for the 1992 Foothills Fire within Boise National Forest</title><geoform>vector digital data</geoform><pubinfo><pubplace>Boise, ID, USA</pubplace><publish>Boise National Forest</publish></pubinfo><ftname Sync="TRUE">footfire</ftname><onlink>http://cloud.insideidaho.org/webApps/util/zip.ashx?fn=http://cloud.insideidaho.org/data/bnf/footfire</onlink></citeinfo></citation><descript><abstract>This data set reflects fire intensity as measured by canopy scorch for the 1992 Foothills Fire, Boise National Forest, Idaho.</abstract><purpose>The data are intended to assist efforts surrounding broad-scale forest planning for analysis in fire-recovery: soil stabilization, reestablishing vegetation, and protection of other resources such as wildlife, riparian habitat, water quality, fisheries and timber. These data should be displayed and analyzed at scales appropriate for 1:24,000-scale data. No responsibility is assumed by the Boise National Forest GIS Staff in the use of these data.</purpose><supplinf>Procedures_Used: Field crews surveyed fire area (ground and air).  Islands < 40 acres usually not mapped.  Burn polygons drawn on paper copies 7 1/2 minute USGS topographical maps, then remanuscripted 1:24000 stable mylar.  Digitized Arc-Info RMSE .003, clean weed 10.  Reviews_Applied_to_Data:  Manuscripts compared with field maps to check for line and attribute accuracy.</supplinf><langdata Sync="TRUE">en</langdata></descript><timeperd><timeinfo><sngdate><caldate>1992</caldate></sngdate></timeinfo><current>ground condition</current></timeperd><status><progress>Complete</progress><update>None planned</update></status><spdom><bounding><westbc>-116.00803765</westbc><eastbc>-115.48600814</eastbc><northbc>43.71266263</northbc><southbc>43.32508003</southbc></bounding><lboundng><leftbc Sync="TRUE">580420.812500</leftbc><rightbc Sync="TRUE">621982.875000</rightbc><bottombc Sync="TRUE">4797799.000000</bottombc><topbc Sync="TRUE">4840228.000000</topbc></lboundng></spdom><keywords><theme><themekt>ISO 19115 Topic Category</themekt><themekey>environment</themekey></theme><theme><themekt>None</themekt><themekey>Burn Intensity</themekey><themekey>Canopy Scorch</themekey><themekey>Fire</themekey><themekey>Wildfire</themekey></theme><place><placekt>Geographic Names Information System (GNIS). perimeter</attrdef><attrdefs>Unknown</attrdefs><attwidth Sync="TRUE">4</attwidth><atoutwid Sync="TRUE">12</atoutwid><attrtype Sync="TRUE">Float</attrtype><atnumdec Sync="TRUE">3</atnumdec><attrdomv><udom Sync="TRUE">Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.</udom></attrdomv></attr><attr><attrlabl>FIN</attrlabl><attrdef>Burn Intensity, Canopy Scorch</attrdef><attrdefs>See narrative</attrdefs><attrdomv><udom>FIN (burn intensity), relative estimate of fire intensity as measured by canopy scorch. Generally areas > 40 acres mapped.  Scorch canopy defined as fire killed needles and leaves that remain on trees or brush. L - Low, < 50%. Canopy "green" with scattered scorched canopy areas. M - 51-100%, usually > 75%. Canopy "red", scattered black, green. H - 100%.  Canopy completely consumed.  Canopy black.</udom></attrdomv><attwidth Sync="TRUE">4</attwidth><atoutwid Sync="TRUE">12</atoutwid><attrtype Sync="TRUE">Float</attrtype><atnumdec Sync="TRUE">3</atnumdec></attr><attr><attrlabl>FOOTFIRE#</attrlabl><attrdef>Internal feature number</attrdef><attrdefs>Computed</attrdefs><attwidth Sync="TRUE">4</attwidth><atoutwid Sync="TRUE">5</atoutwid><attrtype Sync="TRUE">Binary</attrtype><attrdomv><udom Sync="TRUE">Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.</udom></attrdomv></attr><attr><attrlabl>FOOTFIRE-ID</attrlabl><attrdef>User-assigned feature number</attrdef><attrdefs>User-defined</attrdefs><attwidth Sync="TRUE">4</attwidth><atoutwid Sync="TRUE">5</atoutwid><attrtype Sync="TRUE">Binary</attrtype></attr><attr><attrlabl>LC</attrlabl><attrdef>'Don''t know - see narrative'</attrdef><attrdefs>Unknown</attrdefs><attwidth Sync="TRUE">2</attwidth><atoutwid Sync="TRUE">2</atoutwid><attrtype Sync="TRUE">Character</attrtype></attr><attr><attrlabl>PERIMETER</attrlabl><attrdef>Perimeter of poly/region in coverage units</attrdef><attrdefs>Computed</attrdefs><attwidth Sync="TRUE">2</attwidth><atoutwid Sync="TRUE">2</atoutwid><attrtype Sync="TRUE">Character</attrtype></attr><attr><attrlabl>FOOT_BI</attrlabl><attrdef>Unknown</attrdef><attrdefs>Unknown</attrdefs><attwidth Sync="TRUE">1</attwidth><atoutwid Sync="TRUE">1</atoutwid><attrtype Sync="TRUE">Character</attrtype></attr><attr><attrlabl Sync="TRUE">FOOT_BI</attrlabl><attwidth Sync="TRUE">4</attwidth><atoutwid Sync="TRUE">4</atoutwid><attrtype Sync="TRUE">Character</attrtype></attr></detailed><overview><eaover> FIN (burn intensity), relative estimate of fire intensity as measured by canopy scorch. Generally areas > 40 acres mapped.  Scorch canopy defined as fire killed needles and leaves that remain on trees or brush.  L - Low, < 50%. Canopy "green" with scattered scorched canopy areas. M - 51-100%, usually > 75%. Canopy "red", scattered black, green H - 100%.  Canopy completely consumed.  Canopy black.  LC - don't know item was used for.  Item null or = 'F',  all "F"s are High intensity, but not all High intensities are "F". DISS - Item used to dissolve burn intensity into a fire perimeter. </eaover><eadetcit>Not Available</eadetcit></overview></eainfo><distinfo><distrib><cntinfo><cntperp><cntorg>University of Idaho
